Introduction

Welcome to the UMD Libraries!

This is a guide to important reference sources in the field of Public Health and I am the subject specialist librarian for the School of Public Health.

The UM Libraries offer a range of training for research students that will assist with the production of literature reviews including:

  • Sessions on searching electronic databases
  • Using the bibliographic management software (e.g. Zotero, EndNote, Refoworks) to download records
  • Library catalog searching
  • Subject resources
  • Research skills
  • Off-campus student orientation

How can you reach me?

  • Schedule an appointment:
    • Librarian's Office Hour: Thursdays, 2-3 pm at SPH Room 1226 (Spring and Fall semesters; Summer by appointment).
    • At my office, Engineering & Physical Sciences Library (EPSL). 
  • Email: nedelina@umd.edu
  • Skype: detelina44

Where are the collections?

  • Physical collections for public health are located at McKeldin Library.
  • Electronic collections can be accessed at any library on campus, or from off-campus trhough Research Port.
